items.title: Nintendo is paving the way for the Switch 2
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Nintendo introduced virtual game cards that allow easy sharing of digital games between devices.
- These cards function like physical cartridges, enabling users to 'eject' and load games on compatible devices linked to their account.
- The feature will be part of a system update expected in April, coinciding with a major Nintendo Direct that may reveal details about the Switch 2 release.

items.title: Fired Democratic FTC commissioners sue Trump
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Two Democratic FTC commissioners, Kelly Slaughter and Alvaro Bedoya, have filed a lawsuit against Donald Trump and current FTC chair Andrew Ferguson.
- They claim their firing violates federal law and Supreme Court precedents established in the 1935 case *Humphrey’s Executor v. US*.
- The lawsuit seeks to restore the commissioners to their positions, arguing they have a right to complete their terms unless there is cause for removal.

items.title: OpenAI says ‘our GPUs are melting’ as it limits ChatGPT image generation requests
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- OpenAI places temporary rate limits on ChatGPT's image generation due to high demand.
- CEO Sam Altman mentioned, "our GPUs are melting" due to the influx of image requests.
- The rate limit aims to manage the stress on OpenAI's infrastructure and improve efficiency.
- Free tier users will soon be able to generate up to three images per day.
- The new image generation tool uses OpenAI's advanced GPT-4o model, offering more realistic creations.

items.title: Satya Nadella: DeepSeek is the new bar for Microsoft’s AI success
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella deployed DeepSeek’s R1 on Azure in January, setting a new benchmark for AI success.
- Nadella highlighted the efficiency of DeepSeek, which operates with a small team and optimized Nvidia's CUDA layer.
- Despite heavy investments and advertising, Microsoft's Copilot app has not achieved comparable success to ChatGPT in the App Store.
- The company is investing $80 billion in AI and data centers to support its AI-focused engineering groups.
- Microsoft aims for every workload to resemble ChatGPT in complexity and performance, while addressing sustainability in its practices.
- Microsoft believes AI can aid in achieving its carbon-negative goal by 2030, despite critics questioning its feasibility.

items.title: Nintendo’s news app launches with a tiny Switch 2 leak
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- The new Nintendo Today news app launched with a screenshot hinting at the Nintendo Switch 2.  
- A new button labeled 'C' appears on the right-side Joy-Con for the first time.  
- More details about the Switch 2 are expected during the upcoming Switch 2 Direct event on April 2, 2025.

items.title: Amazon Big Spring Sale: All the Deals You Should Know About
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Amazon's Big Spring Sale runs from now until March 31, 2025, offering discounts on a range of products including gardening supplies, electronics, and household items.
- Up to 87 deals are highlighted, including savings on popular tech such as security cameras, headphones, and smartwatches.
- Major discounts include the Samsung 990 Pro 4TB SSD for $279.99, significantly lower than the new 9100 Pro at $549.99.
- Notable deals on wireless earbuds and the Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra robot vacuum, discounted by $700, are part of the sale.

items.title: iPhone users can now set WhatsApp as their default calling and texting app
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- WhatsApp can now be set as the default app for calls and texts on iPhones after updating to version 25.8.74.
- Users can select WhatsApp in the Messaging and Calling default app settings in iOS.
- This feature was initially announced for the European Union but will be available for all users in iOS 18.2.
- Changing the default app allows the selected app to open when interacting with phone numbers or messages from contacts.

items.title: Robosen’s self-transforming Bumblebee is finally giving Optimus Prime some backup
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Robosen is launching a new self-transforming Bumblebee robot toy in partnership with Hasbro, featuring 31 servo motors.
- Bumblebee can transform from a robot to a classic Volkswagen Beetle, controllable via smartphone and Robosen’s app.
- The toy is available for preorder at $949, with a full price of $1,299, and responds to 48 voice commands while being customizable through a block-based programming language.

items.title: Audio-Technica’s R2-D2 earbuds play beeps and bloops for audio alerts
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Audio-Technica announced limited edition ATH-CKS50TW2 wireless earbuds themed after Star Wars characters ahead of the Star Wars Celebration Japan on April 18, 2025.
- The earbuds feature custom audio alerts with sound effects from characters like R2-D2 and Darth Vader.
- Priced at $179, the earbuds will be available for pre-order starting April 21 and released on May 4, 2025.
- They provide up to 40 hours of battery life with Active Noise Cancelling (ANC) and have a 'Magnetic Switch' for power management when the earbuds are joined together.

items.title: Microsoft is giving its Office apps a speed boost
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft aims to enhance the startup speed of Office apps, beginning with Word in May.
- A new Startup Boost task will operate silently during system boot to reduce launch times.
- Startup Boost requires a minimum of 8GB RAM and 5GB disk space, and it will be disabled in Energy Saver mode.
- Users have the option to disable this feature within Office applications, and IT admins can manage it through settings in the app.
- Microsoft’s approach utilizes scheduled tasks for performance optimization, similar to practices used by other technology companies.

items.title: Amazon Luna gets EA games and is launching in more countries
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary: - Amazon Luna adds several Electronic Arts games to its library, including titles from the Star Wars franchise and sports games. - The first collection of EA games will be available tomorrow for Luna Plus subscribers, featuring Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order, and Dead Space. - Luna is expanding to new countries, including Sweden, Portugal, Belgium, and Luxembourg, after launching in the US in 2022.

items.title: Before Lazarus hits Adult Swim, listen to some of its transcendent music
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary: - Upcoming Adult Swim series Lazarus premieres on April 5th. - Soundtracks feature Kamasi Washington, Bonobo, and Floating Points. - Main theme "Vortex" by Kamasi Washington, along with singles from Bonobo and Floating Points available now. - Full soundtracks to be released on April 11th, indicating a strong entry into the series.

items.title: Pokémon Legends: Z-A’s gameplay will change depending on the time of day
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The game introduces a real-time day/night cycle affecting gameplay mechanics.
- During the day, players focus on catching Pokémon, while at night, battles intensify with NPC trainers.
- The game features a competition called the Z-A Royale, where trainers can engage in battle by making eye contact.
- Players can gain an advantage by sneaking up on trainers during battles.
- Progressing through the ranks from Z to A is essential for completing the game’s story.

items.title: It’s cheaper than ever to get a 4TB PCIe 4 SSD
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Samsung's 4TB 990 Pro SSD is currently priced at $279.99.
- This is nearly half the price of Samsung's newer 9100 Pro ($549.99).
- The 990 Pro is compatible with PCIe Gen 4 hardware, making it a better choice for those not ready for Gen 5.
- The 2TB version of the 990 Pro costs $170, making the 4TB a better value for increasing game install sizes.
- The recommended 990 Pro model does not come with a heatsink; buyers can save by adding their own instead of paying for the heatsink version from Samsung.

items.title: Elon Musk pressured Reddit’s CEO on content moderation
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- Elon Musk publicly criticized Reddit for blocking links to his platform, calling it 'insane'.
- Musk privately messaged Reddit CEO Steve Huffman, leading to a 72-hour ban on the subreddit "WhitePeopleTwitter" due to violent content.
- Reddit's spokesperson stated they take policy violations seriously and will act if necessary.
- The communication was discussed among Reddit moderators, raising concerns about Musk's influence on platform moderation.

items.title: Amazon tests renaming Echo smart displays to Alexa
Nintendo introduces new lending system for digital Switch games
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo announces a new game management system called "virtual game cards" for the Switch, coming in an April update.
- Virtual game cards will allow transfers of digital games between consoles using a local Wi-Fi connection.
- Users can lend games to members of their Nintendo Switch Family account for two weeks, replicating the spirit of video game rentals.

items.title: Light Phone III review: everything in moderation
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The Light Phone III is priced at $599 and emphasizes essential smartphone features without being a full smartphone.
- It includes a 50-megapixel camera, 5G connectivity, and a bright AMOLED touchscreen, making it more functional than previous models.
- The device aims to reduce screen time and is gaining popularity among parents and schools as a substitute for traditional smartphones.
- Some features like NFC, front-facing camera, and fingerprint reader are currently inactive but will be activated by future updates.
- Overall design is sleek but may not appeal to everyone; it's described as having an industrial feel.
- Users may miss essential smartphone functionalities like popular app support and easy integration with their existing digital life.

items.title: Caterpillar taps Luminar’s lidar for self-driving construction equipment
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Caterpillar is integrating Luminar’s lidar technology into its autonomy platform for construction equipment.
- Initial implementation includes two lidar sensors in highway trucks used for quarry operations.
- Caterpillar has sold autonomous trucks on three continents, traveling over 207 million miles.
- The integration aims to enhance safety, productivity, and efficiency in heavy-duty machinery.
- Lidar technology detects object shapes and distances using near-infrared light, improving safety in construction environments.
- Luminar's Iris sensors operate at a 1550nm wavelength, effective in dusty conditions, and are favored by major automotive manufacturers like Mercedes-Benz and Volvo.

items.title: How to keep your Venmo account private
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- Venmo is widely used for money transfers but can expose personal information if not secured.
- Users should check and adjust their privacy settings, ideally setting transactions to Private.
- It is possible to hide past transactions and friends list to enhance privacy.
- Location settings can also be adjusted to limit visibility.
- Venmo defaults to more private settings when multiple accounts are involved.

items.title: Nintendo Launches News App to Keep Players Updated
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced a new app called [Nintendo Today](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nintendo.com%2Fus%2Fstore%2Fproducts%2Fnintendo-today-mobile%2F) during its Direct event, designed to keep players updated on Nintendo news.
- The app will be available on both iOS and Android and will complement Nintendo’s popular livestream events.
- Content will include news, videos, and comics from various Nintendo franchises, functioning like a daily calendar.
- Nintendo Today will be launching later today, though it was not yet available in app stores at the time of the announcement.
- The launch coincides with a busy period for Nintendo, which includes a new console, theme parks, and films.

items.title: ChatGPT is turning everything into Studio Ghibli art — and it got weird fast
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- AI-generated image creation has improved significantly, leading to a trend of creating images in the style of Studio Ghibli.
- Users initially engaged in wholesome transformations of portraits and pets but the trend soon escalated into bizarre alterations of historical events and public figures.
- OpenAI has guidelines that permit artistic depictions, even in chaotic contexts, while maintaining some restrictions to protect the likenesses of living artists.

items.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond’s new trailer is an intro to its alien world
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - Nintendo unveiled a new trailer for Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, showcasing the alien world and Samus' abilities, including new psychic powers. - The game is set to release in 2025 for the Nintendo Switch but lacks a specific date. - Initially announced in 2017, the game's development was rebooted in early 2019, and Retro Studios was brought on board. - A previous gameplay trailer was released, indicating a focus on intense firefights and exploration, with a vague release timeframe for 2025. - The Nintendo Switch has been a strong platform for Metroid games, featuring titles like Metroid Dread and remastered versions of classic titles.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 preorders start April 2nd, according to Best Buy Canada
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Preorders for the Nintendo Switch 2 will open on **April 2nd, 2025**.
- This date coincides with a Nintendo Direct presentation starting at **9 AM ET / 6 AM PT**.
- The platform will allow customers to secure their console early, though the exact time for preorder launch has not been confirmed.
- Previous Switch preorders were initiated after a 2017 presentation.
- Best Buy Canada had initially announced this via a now-removed blog post.
- The Nintendo Switch 2 features include a larger screen, backwards compatibility with Switch 1 games, and new Joy-Con functionalities.
- Launch of the Nintendo Switch 2 is anticipated for **June 2025**.

items.title: Capitalism vs. the bird flu
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Discussion on the bird flu and its implications on egg prices and agriculture.
- First confirmed human death linked to bird flu reported in January.
- Concerns about new H5N1 strains spreading to other animals, including cows.
- Criticism of Robert Kennedy Jr. and his handling of public health in relation to bird flu.
- Industrial agriculture's vulnerability highlighted amid potential bird flu outbreaks.
- Need for collective action to manage bird flu effectively.

items.title: GMC Sierra electric truck now starts at $64,495 with new Elevation and ATF trims
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins

items.title: All the news from Nintendo’s March Direct showcase
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo will host a 30-minute Direct showcase on March 27th at 10AM ET.
- The Direct will focus on upcoming games for the Nintendo Switch, with no news about the upcoming Switch 2.
- Potential announcements may include remasters of classic titles like The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker and Twilight Princess.

items.title: Google Maps can soon scan your screenshots to plan your vacation
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google Maps is adding a feature that identifies locations in users' screenshots and saves them to a list for trip planning.
- The screenshot list feature is powered by Gemini and will roll out to iOS users in the US this week, with Android support coming soon.
- New itinerary-building features for travel planning in Google Search can create trip ideas based on user queries, available in English this week.
- Price drop alerts for Google Flights are now also available for hotel searches globally, allowing users to receive notifications for chosen dates and destinations.

items.title: Instacart will pay shoppers to take videos of store shelves
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Instacart introduces Store View, allowing shoppers to earn money by recording videos of store shelves to track product availability.
- The data collected will help Instacart's predictive models to estimate restock times for items.
- Store View will launch with select retailers soon, expanding across the US and Canada through 2025.
- Instacart is also rolling out Second Store Check to find out-of-stock items from alternative locations without extra fees.

items.title: Want to feel like a spy? Stick a smart chip in your manicure
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Jakcom N3 Smart Nail Chip can transmit data using NFC technology similar to contactless payments.
- Available in sets priced at $20, $36, and $60, it can be programmed for various functions like contact sharing or quick texts.
- Users may face challenges with securing the chip on nails and achieving reliable scans with mobile devices.
- The experience can vary significantly based on the application method of the chip and nail type used.
- Additional features allow users to program the chip for more personalized tasks, expanding its utility beyond its default settings.

items.title: Garmin adds AI and a subscription tier to its app
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Garmin has launched Garmin Connect Plus, a premium app tier offering AI-powered insights and features.
- Users can opt for a 30-day free trial, followed by a subscription of $6.99 monthly or $69.99 annually.
- Existing health data and features will remain free and accessible.
- The new feature, Active Intelligence, will provide personalized insights based on user health and activity data.
- Connect Plus includes a performance dashboard, live activity metrics on smartphones, and expanded LiveTrack features.
- Garmin continues to face competition from brands like Apple and Samsung in the wearable tech market.

items.title: Vivaldi bundles Proton VPN into its web browser
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Vivaldi integrates the free version of Proton VPN directly into its web browser, available today for desktop users.
- Users can log in with a Vivaldi account to access Proton VPN, which allows connections to servers in five randomly selected countries.
- Paid Proton VPN upgrades are available from $10/month for enhanced speed and server options across more than 110 countries.
- This integration aims to make VPN access easier and more accessible compared to traditional browser extensions.
- The partnership emphasizes shared values between Vivaldi and Proton, focusing on privacy and independence from major tech influences.

items.title: Uber Shuttle will get you to JFK airport for $10
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Uber is expanding its airport shuttle service to JFK for $10 until April 30th, after which it will increase to $25.
- The shuttle aims to provide an affordable option compared to typical Uber fares of $80 to JFK.
- Customers can book rides for up to four passengers and validate their reservations with QR codes.
- Service operates on four routes from locations in Manhattan and Brooklyn, every 30 minutes from 5 AM to 10:45 PM.
- Uber partners with ETS, a licensed shuttle operator, and has previously launched shuttle services for concerts and other airports.

items.title: Poco’s F7 Ultra is a midrange phone with a flagship chip
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Poco F7 Ultra features the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, priced at £649 (approx. $835).
- It includes a triple rear camera setup: 50MP main, 50MP telephoto (2.5x), and 32MP ultrawide, with a 32MP selfie camera.
- The 6.67-inch OLED display has a 1440p resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate; it houses a 5,300mAh battery with 120W wired and 50W wireless charging.
- Comes with an IP68 rating for dust and water resistance, but uses Poco’s own Shield Glass for display protection.
- There's a less expensive F7 Pro model at £499 (approx. $645) with the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 and a downgraded camera setup available in the UK and Europe.

items.title: Robinhood is launching bank accounts that will deliver physical cash ‘to your doorstep’
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Robinhood announced the launch of a wholly online banking platform called Robinhood Banking in fall 2023.
- The platform will offer checking and savings accounts for Robinhood Gold subscribers, including cash delivery to users' doorsteps based on location.
- Customers will earn a 4% annual percentage yield (APY) and enjoy FDIC insurance up to $2.5 million through a partnership with Coastal Community Bank.
- New accounts will include individual, joint, and children’s options, addressing challenges of legacy banks.
- Robinhood will also release a wealth management platform named Robinhood Strategies with managed ETFs and stocks for a fee of 0.25%.
- An AI-powered investment tool called Cortex is set to launch later this year, providing market insights to Gold subscribers.

items.title: Republicans push for child safety laws amid concerns over FTC enforcement
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- House Energy and Commerce subcommittee discussed child online safety, a typically bipartisan topic, with rising tensions.
- Republicans aim to revive the blocked Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA) while Democrats question FTC enforcement capacity after recent firings by Trump.
- Trump's illegal attempt to fire Democratic FTC commissioners raises concerns about accountability and transparency in enforcing child safety laws.
- Democrats emphasize the importance of having effective enforcement for laws like KOSA and COPPA 2.0, warning that without the FTC, the legislation is ineffective.
- The political landscape complicates discussions of child safety measures, as critiques grow regarding the influence of Big Tech on Republican priorities.

items.title: Nothing’s colorful, entry-level earbuds have fallen to their best price to date
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Nothing Ear (a) earbuds are on sale for $77.50 on [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Nothing-Ear-Integration-Cancelling-Equaliser/dp/B0D2XYTB85/?th=1&tag=theverge02-20), a $23 discount.
- They feature active noise cancellation (ANC), decent sound quality, and customizable settings via the Nothing app.
- The earbuds support multipoint Bluetooth pairing and a low-latency gaming mode, alongside unique features like ChatGPT integration for Nothing phone users.

items.title: Trump Plans 25% Tariff on Imported Vehicles
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 25% tariff on imported vehicles effective April 2, 2025.
- The tariffs will apply to cars and trucks imported into the US, including those made by American companies abroad.
- Trump claims the tariffs will lead to growth in the auto industry but will likely increase consumer prices by approximately 5% according to a 2024 USITC analysis.
- The tariffs will coincide with other reciprocal tariffs expected to affect various trading partners.

items.title: Microsoft revamps its Windows Game Bar
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced updates to Xbox for March, including a new design for Game Bar on PC.
- The Game Bar now features a cleaner user interface with lighter colors and a simpler layout.
- Xbox Cloud Gaming allows players to switch between games without returning to the Home page, starting with select “Assassin's Creed” titles.
- In-game benefits are expanding to more free-to-play titles including “Heroes in the Storm” and “Call of Duty: Warzone” in April, allowing players to earn cosmetics and currency.

items.title: Amazon’s Big Spring Sale Offers 75 Best Deals Ahead of Prime Day
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon's Big Spring Sale is live from now until March 31, 2025.
- Discounts are available on gardening supplies, bedding, security cameras, headphones, smartwatches, and more tech products.
- Items available at competitors include deals from Best Buy, Walmart, and Target.
- Featured deals include a $76 Anker wall charger, $34 Hoto electric screwdriver, $150 Shokz headphones, and $170 Apple AirPods Pro with improved features.

items.title: ChatGPT’s new image generator is delayed for free users
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- OpenAI delays the rollout of ChatGPT’s image generator for free users due to unexpected popularity.
- CEO Sam Altman announced the delay in a post on Wednesday.
- Image generation capabilities were added to ChatGPT recently, using GPT-4o model.
- The new tool allows users to create images, including styles like Studio Ghibli.
- Currently available for ChatGPT Plus, Pro, and Team subscribers; no timeline for free users yet.

items.title: YouTube Shorts will count views even if you scroll past
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- YouTube will change its Shorts view counting method starting March 31st, similar to TikTok and Instagram.
- Views will count when a Short starts to play or replay, not just after a specific duration.
- YouTube aims to align creators' view counts across platforms and may result in higher reported view counts.
- Old metrics will still be tracked under 'engaged views' for analytics and creator earnings.

items.title: Marvel unveils the gigantic cast for Avengers: Doomsday
Some Kindles now let you double-tap anywhere to turn the page
Amazon Spring Sale deals on Verge staff home favorites
The Shokz OpenRun Pro 2 are worth their full price, but are more tempting at $30 off
The best foldable phone you can buy
Apple blocked from presenting at Google antitrust hearing where $20 billion search deal is at stake
The 20 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
Microsoft’s account sign-in UI gets a new design and dark mode
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is rolling out a new sign-in screen for over a billion users that includes a dark mode and is based on Fluent 2 design.
- The redesign emphasizes a passwordless authentication experience, reducing cognitive load and speeding up the sign-in process.
- Initial rollout begins for Xbox users, with web and mobile apps receiving updates throughout March and April, while consumer profiles only will see these changes.
